content: Unfortunatley it doesn't work that way because another one of key elements of the CG besides counter-narcotics is search and rescue. Plus there has been a new policy put in place on how these interdictions are conducted and really puts us in a bind when we are trying to recover the contraband as well as the crew. It's still a work in progress however and I'm confident we will still figure out a way to beat this new technology. quote: Originally posted by MKArnold: Concur with ENYVTHS - just leave them. I have invented the IIWS(Individual Invisible Weapon System), the IIWS is a new-generation, invisible infantry weapon designed for effectiveness against OICW (Objective Individual Combat Weapon) and AICW (Advanced Infantry Combat Weapon) , because OICW, AICW and all kinds of soldier combat system utilise traditional face to face shot mode, and must expose their two hands at least. If you use OICW and AICW, you can't hit what you can't see and if the enemy is in range. The IIWS means both invisible weapon and a invisible shooter, Compared with the existing weapon, there are not any difference in accuracy and range. You thought smart arms were cool. Well, this IIWS takes smart weapons to the next level. Imagine a city being attacked by your enemy. Both your enemy and you are using conventional arms, But you have the advantage, you have a IIWS, you may conceal yourself behind heavy bullet proof shelters. Your weapon has the function of “Hiding User”. Now that you may take cover from the enemy’s fire, you may strike at the enemy from every conceivable cover, you may hit the enemy when they least expected you too. You don't need to directly face the enemy like current arms. You point your gun to their position, you can press many many enemy hard by yourself. which will be perfect and secure. With the IIWS, straight aiming line is no longer a rule for infantry fights! It will be widely being used by Special Forces, military units and law enforcement agencies around the world. content: quote: Semi-Subs are Latest Coke Traffickers Tool You must have missed the documentary some time ago on the history channel when a pretended buyer flush with drug millions went to Russia and inquired about buying Russian subs that were sitting idle and rusting in a ship yard since the collapse of the Soviet Union. The potential (blackmarket) seller's answer was a chilling one. Surprisingly, he said in a very casual tone, "With or without missiles." Luckily, a sting was in the process and nabbed all the players, but if you think they will stick to home-made subs....not for long - - Wandering and Wondering
